intro: Cnestis palala var. brevistylis, commonly known as the short-styled cnestis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It is typically found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to its native environment, making it a notable species in regional flora.
